riddles.question: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I?
I can fly without wings. I can cry without eyes. Wherever I go, darkness follows me. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter but can't go outside. What am I?
I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers but no water. What am I?
What has a heart that doesn't beat?
I am taken from a mine and shut in a wooden case. From far away, I am sought for my sound. What am I?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
I can be flipped and broken but I never move. I can be closed and opened, and sometimes removed. What am I?
I am full of holes but can still hold water. What am I?
What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
The more you have of me, the less you see. What am I?
I have a head and a tail but no body. What am I?
What belongs to you but is used by others more than you?
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even. What number am I?
What gets wetter as it dries?
I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter, but can't go outside. What am I?
What has one eye but can't see?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
I am always in front of you, but you can never see me. What am I?
What has many keys but can't open any locks?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
I am an insect, and the first part of my name is the name of another insect. What am I?
I am a word of letters three. Add two, and fewer there will be. What word am I?
I am a box that holds keys without locks, yet they can unlock your soul. What am I?
I am taken from a mine and shut in a wooden case. From far away, I am sought for my sound. What am I?
I am always hungry, I must always be fed. The finger I touch, will soon turn red. What am I?
What has cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers but no water?
What has keys but can't open locks?
I have a head and a tail but no body. What am I?
I am white when I am dirty, and black when I am clean. What am I?
What has a face that doesn't frown, a beard that doesn't grow, and can't speak a word?
What has a heart that doesn't beat?
I have a neck but no head. I have a body but no arms. I have leaves but no branches. What am I?
I am not alive, but I can grow. I don't have lungs, but I need air to survive. What am I?
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
What goes up but never comes down?
I have a hundred legs, but I can't walk. What am I?
I am full of holes but can still hold water. What am I?
What has keys but can't open locks?
I am an insect, and the first part of my name is the name of another insect. What am I?
I am a word of letters three. Add two, and fewer there will be. What word am I?
I am a box that holds keys without locks, yet they can unlock your soul. What am I?
I am taken from a mine and shut in a wooden case. From far away, I am sought for my sound. What am I?
I am always hungry, I must always be fed. The finger I touch, will soon turn red. What am I?
